webServer

Class Request

  • java.lang.Object
    • webServer.Request
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Request
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    A simple Request class, which is spawned whenever a new request comes in. Enables the server to handle multiple clients at once. Features: + GZIP compression + MIME Type guessing + Etag support for if-Match, if-None-Match, and if-Modified-Since + Allow to discover subdirectories + Multithreading TODOs: - improve file transfer speed, a socket sends approx. 100kb/s. - introduce more robust parsing of the inbound request to prevent bad actors - introduce MIME sniffing for more accurate results * @author Oguzhan Yigit * @email yigit@adobe.com * @version 0.1

      • guessMimeType

        private void guessMimeType(java.lang.String filename,
                           java.lang.String fileEnding)
        Guesses the Mime type based on the file ending. Very fuzzy implementation, content sniffing is out of scope.
        Parameters:
        filename - The filename we want to guess
        fileEnding - The file ending we use to guess

      • parseType

      • parsePath

        private java.lang.String parsePath(java.lang.String rawRequest)
        Parses the path, the second argument in the HTTP request.
        Parameters:
        rawRequest - the second word of the request.
        Returns:
        The path to be queried.

      • exploreDirectoryOrFile

        private void exploreDirectoryOrFile(java.lang.String requestedPath,
                                    Request.Type method,
                                    java.lang.String tag,
                                    java.util.Date threshold,
                                    Request.Mode mode)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Explores a directory or a file. If it turns out as a directory, return a list of all files and directories within that directory. If it turns out as a file return the file by guessing its Mime type in a gzipped way. If the Mime type cannot be determined, fall back to gzip.
        Parameters:
        requestedPath - The path the client wants to retrieve
        method - The method the client uses to retrieve the content
        tag - The provided Etag for comparison
        threshold - The provided last modified date the client knows
        mode - Etag mode
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - We throw an exception if we have trouble opening the file

      • readFile

        private java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream readFile(java.io.File givenPath)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Compresses the FIS into GZIP. Due to Content-Encoding, the browser will decompress it on the fly.
        Parameters:
        givenPath - the file we want to compress
        Returns:
        Bytestream to write to socket
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - We throw an exception if the file cannot be opened.

      • parseHttp

        private void parseHttp()
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       java.text.ParseException
        Parses the HTTP Request and calls the methods to query the directory or file. Currently parses: - HTTP Method - Path - If-None-Match - If-Match - If-Modified-Since
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - We throw an IOException in case we cannot read from the socket
        java.text.ParseException - We throw a ParseException if we cannot parse the given request

      • writeHeaderToSocket

        private void writeHeaderToSocket(java.lang.String message)
        Writes back the http Header to the clientSocket.
        Parameters:
        message - The http Header.

      • writeBodyToSocket

        private void writeBodyToSocket(byte[] message)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Writes back the HTTP body as a bytestream, as we need to transfer files byte by byte.
        Parameters:
        message - The file content.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - We throw an IOException if we get interrupted while writing to the output socket
